question: In what type of animals may a body cavity be present or absent?

nodes.text: Vertebrates are animals in which a body cavity may be present or absent.
Bicellular animals may have a body cavity that is present or absent.
Nonvascular animals may have a body cavity that is present or absent.
Triploblastic animals may have a body cavity that is present or absent.
